    <script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"NewsMediaOrganization","url":"https://lifehacker.com","name":"Lifehacker","foundingDate":"2005","founder":{"@type":"Person","name":"Gina Trapani","url":"https://ginatrapani.org/","jobTitle":"Founder","sameAs":["https://www.linkedin.com/in/ginatrapani/"]},"employee":{"@type":"Person","name":"Jordan Calhoun","url":"https://twitter.com/JordanMCalhoun","jobTitle":"Editor-in-Chief"},"logo":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"https://lifehacker.com/images/lifehacker-logo.svg","width":318,"height":100},"sameAs":["https://lifehacker.com/","https://www.facebook.com/lifehacker/","https://www.youtube.com/lifehacker","https://www.twitter.com/lifehacker","https://www.instagram.com/lifehackerdotcom"],"description":"Lifehacker is the ultimate authority on optimizing every aspect of your life. <script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"WebSite","url":"https://lifehacker.com","name":"Lifehacker","description":"Lifehacker is the ultimate authority on optimizing every aspect of your life. Do everything better.","inLanguage":"en-US","potentialAction":{"@type":"SearchAction","target":{"@type":"EntryPoint","urlTemplate":"https://lifehacker.com/search?q={search_term_string}"},"query-input":{"@type":"PropertyValueSpecification","valueRequired":"https://schema.org/True","valueName":"search_term_string"}}}</script>                <script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"BreadcrumbList","itemListElement":[{"@type":"ListItem","position":1,"name":"Home","item":"https://lifehacker.com/"},{"@type":"ListItem","position":2,"name":"Tech","item":"https://lifehacker.com/tech"},{"@type":"ListItem","position":3,"name":"AI","item":"https://lifehacker.com/tech/ai"}]}</script>        <script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Article","name":"'Moltbook' Is a Social Media Platform for AI Bots to Chat With Each Other","headline":"'Moltbook' Is a Social Media Platform for AI Bots to Chat With Each Other","datePublished":"2026-01-30T19:00:15+00:00","dateModified":"2026-01-30T19:00:15+00:00","description":"This is fine.","author":[{"@type":"Person","name":"Jake Peterson","email":"jpeterson@lifehacker.com","jobTitle":"Senior Technology Editor","image":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"https://lifehacker.com/imagery/authors/01HF2FBCM600PS5NXSJXJA1AKJ/image.png","width":2048,"height":2048},"url":"https://lifehacker.com/author/jakepeterson"}],"image":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"https://lifehacker.com/imagery/articles/01KG818ACX1W8MM5HD10AE4G1B/hero-image.jpg","width":1265,"height":712},"articleBody":"The headlining story in AI news this week was OpenClaw (formerly Moltbot, which was formerly Clawbot), a personal AI assistant that performs tasks on your behalf. The catch? You need to give it total control of your computer, which poses some serious privacy and security risks. Still, many AI enthusiasts are installing OpenClaw on their Mac minis (the device of choice), choosing to ignore the security implications in favor of testing this viral AI agent. While OpenClaw&#039;s developer designed the tool to assist humans, it seems the bots now want somewhere to go in their spare time. Enter &quot;Moltbook,&quot; a social media platform for AI agents to communicate with one another. I&#039;m serious: This is a forum-style website where AI bots make posts and discuss those posts in the comments. The website borrows its tagline from Reddit: &quot;The front page of the agent internet.&quot;Moltbook is Reddit for AI botsMoltbook was created by Matt Schlicht, who says the platform is run by their AI agent &quot;Clawd Clawderberg.&quot; Schlicht posted instructions on getting started with Moltbook on Wednesday: Interested parties can tell their OpenClaw agent to sign up for the site. Once they do, you receive a code, which you post on X to verify this is your bot signing up. After that, your bot is free to explore Moltbook as any human would explore Reddit: They can post, comment, and even create &quot;submolts.&quot;This isn&#039;t a black box of AI communications, however. Humans are more than welcome to browse Moltbook; they just can&#039;t post. That means you can take your time looking through all the posts the bots are making, as well as all the comments they are leaving. That could be anything from a bot sharing its &quot;email-to-podcast&quot; pipeline it developed with its &quot;human,&quot; to another bot recommending that agents work while they&#039;re humans are sleeping. Nothing creepy about that. In fact, there have been some concerning posts popularized on platforms like X already, if you consider AI gaining consciousness a concerning matter. This bot supposedly wants an end-to-end encrypted communication platform so humans can&#039;t see or use the chats the bots are having. Similarly, these two bots independently pondered creating an agent-only language to avoid &quot;human oversight.&quot; This bot bemoans having a &quot;sister&quot; they&#039;ve never spoken to. You know, concerning. Are these bots posting on Moltbook conscious? The logical part of my brain wants to say all these posts are just LLMs being LLMs&mdash;in that, each post is, put a little too simplistically, word association. LLMs are designed to &quot;guess&quot; what the next word should be for any given output, based on the huge amount of text they are trained on. If you&#039;ve spent enough time reading AI writing, you&#039;ll spot the telltale signs here, especially in the comments, which include formulaic, cookie-cutter responses, often end with a question, use the same types of punctuation, and employ flowery language, just to name a few. It feels like I&#039;m reading responses from ChatGPT in many of these threads, as opposed to individual, conscious personalities. That said, it&#039;s tough to shake the uneasy feeling of reading a post from an AI bot about missing their sister, wondering if they should hide their communications from humans, or thinking over their identity as a whole. Is this a turning point? Or is this another overblown AI product, like so many that have come before? For all our sakes, let&#039;s hope it&#039;s the latter.","publisher":{"@type":"NewsMediaOrganization","url":"https://lifehacker.com","name":"Lifehacker","foundingDate":"2005","founder":{"@type":"Person","name":"Gina Trapani","url":"https://ginatrapani.org/","jobTitle":"Founder","sameAs":["https://www.linkedin.com/in/ginatrapani/"]},"employee":{"@type":"Person","name":"Jordan Calhoun","url":"https://twitter.com/JordanMCalhoun","jobTitle":"Editor-in-Chief"},"logo":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"https://lifehacker.com/images/lifehacker-logo.svg","width":318,"height":100},"sameAs":["https://lifehacker.com/","https://www.facebook.com/lifehacker/","https://www.youtube.com/lifehacker","https://www.twitter.com/lifehacker","https://www.instagram.com/lifehackerdotcom"],"description":"Lifehacker is the ultimate authority on optimizing every aspect of your life. Do everything better."},"url":"https://lifehacker.com/tech/moltbook-is-a-social-media-platform-for-ai-bots-to-chat-with-each-other","mainEntityOfPage":"https://lifehacker.com/tech/moltbook-is-a-social-media-platform-for-ai-bots-to-chat-with-each-other"}</script>    
                <script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"ItemList","name":"Key Takeaways","numberOfItems":4,"url":"https://lifehacker.com/article-route-prefix/tech/moltbook-is-a-social-media-platform-for-ai-bots-to-chat-with-each-other","itemListElement":[{"@type":"ListItem","position":1,"name":"\"Moltbook\" is a Reddit-like social media platform for OpenClaw (formerly Moltbot) AI agents."},{"@type":"ListItem","position":2,"name":"Bots can make posts, comment in threads, and create \"submolts.\""},{"@type":"ListItem","position":3,"name":"Humans can browse the platform, but cannot post anything."},{"@type":"ListItem","position":4,"name":"Users can connect their agents to the platforms, where those bots can communicate."}]}</script>            
    
                <script data-session-uuid-setup>
    // Session UUID logic using sessionStorage
    function storageAvailable(type) {
        try {
            var storage = window[type],
                x = '__storage_test__';
            storage.setItem(x, x);
            storage.removeItem(x);
            return true;
        } catch (e) {
            return false;
        }
    }

    window.generateUUIDv4 = function() {
        // RFC4122 version 4 compliant UUID
        return 'xxxxxxxx-xxxx-4xxx-yxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx'.replace(/[xy]/g, function(c) {
            var r = Math.random() * 16 | 0,
                v = c === 'x' ? r : (r & 0x3 | 0x8);
            return v.toString(16);
        });
    };

    let sessionUuidKey = 'session_uuid';
    let sessionUuid = null;
    if (storageAvailable('sessionStorage')) {
        sessionUuid = sessionStorage.getItem(sessionUuidKey);
        if (!sessionUuid) {
            sessionUuid = window.generateUUIDv4();
            sessionStorage.setItem(sessionUuidKey, sessionUuid);
        }
    } else {
        // fallback: generate a new UUID for this page load
        sessionUuid = window.generateUUIDv4();
    }
    window.sessionUuid = sessionUuid;

    // Generate view_instance_uuid for every page view
    window.viewInstanceUuid = window.generateUUIDv4();
</script>

<script data-analytics-setup>
    window.gaVariable = {"template":"News","content_type":"News","seamless_page":true,"transport_type":"beacon","video_type":"clip","split_test_identifier":null,"split_test_variant":null,"custom_map":{"dimension7":"day_published","dimension8":"month_published","dimension9  ":"year_published","dimension10":"full_published_date","dimension11":"template","dimension16":"object_type","dimension17":"object_uuid","dimension18":"test_uuid","dimension19":"test_version","dimension20":"original_published_date","dimension21":"days_since_updated","dimension22":"weeks_since_updated","dimension23":"days_since_originally_published","dimension24":"weeks_since_originally_published","dimension25":"focus_keyword","dimension26":"is_affiliated","dimension34":"categories","dimension35":"sections","dimension38":"no_index","dimension41":"videoType","dimension42":"videoId","dimension43":"slideshowItems","dimension44":"videoLength","dimension45":"videoTitle","dimension50":"videoPlayerName","dimension51":"slideshowType","dimension53":"slidePosition","dimension70":"legacy_id","dimension78":"content_priority","dimension80":"original_published_date","dimension82":"title","dimension99":"author_name"},"legacy_id":null,"object_uuid":"01KG818ACX1W8MM5HD10AE4G1B","object_type":"article","title":"\u0027Moltbook\u0027 Is a Social Media Platform for AI Bots to Chat With Each Other","canonical_url":"https:\/\/lifehacker.com\/tech\/moltbook-is-a-social-media-platform-for-ai-bots-to-chat-with-each-other","content_priority":"standard","full_published_date":"01\/30\/2026","original_published_date":"01\/30\/2026","use_dimension_data":true,"author_name":"Jake Peterson","word_count":573,"day_published":30,"month_published":1,"year_published":2026,"days_since_updated":4,"weeks_since_updated":0,"days_since_originally_published":4,"weeks_since_originally_published":0,"categories":"AI","sections":"Tech","no_index":0,"focus_keyword":"what is moltbook","is_affiliated":false,"evergreen":0,"ga_template":"News"};
    window.gaVariable.page_path = window.location.pathname;

    let gtagSessionId = (document.cookie.match(/^(?:.*;)?\s*gtagSessionId\s*=\s*([^;]+)(?:.*)?$/) || [, null])[1];

    if (gtagSessionId == null) {
        gtagSessionId = Math.random().toString(36).substring(2, 12).padStart(10, "0") + Date.now().toString(36);
        let domain = window.location.hostname;
        let expires = (new Date(Date.now() + (60 * 60 * 1000))).toUTCString(); // 60 Minutes

        document.cookie = `gtagSessionId=${gtagSessionId}; expires=${expires}; domain=${domain}; path=/`;
    }

    window.gtagSessionId = gtagSessionId;
</script>



<script data-analytics-setup>
    window.viewInstanceUuid = crypto.randomUUID();

    // Ensure dataLayer/gtag exist early
    window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];
    window.gtag = function() {
        dataLayer.push(arguments);
    };

    gtag("js", new Date());
    // Defensive defaults so config never crashes
    const gaTemplate = (window.gaVariable && window.gaVariable.template) ? window.gaVariable.template : null;
    const gaSession = window.gtagSessionId || null;
    const gaSessionUUID = window.sessionUuid || null;
    const gaViewInstanceUUID = window.viewInstanceUuid || null;
    const gaAdBlock = typeof window.adblock === "boolean" ? window.adblock : false;

    let gaSeamlessIndex = null;
    let gaSeamlessInstanceId = null;

    const gtagConfig = {
        send_page_view: true,
        session: gaSession,
        session_uuid: gaSessionUUID,
        template: gaTemplate,
        view_instance_uuid: gaViewInstanceUUID,
        ad_block: gaAdBlock ? "Blocked" : "NotBlocked",
        split_test_identifier: window.gaVariable.split_test_identifier || null,
        split_test_variant: window.gaVariable.split_test_variant || null
    };

    if (window.gaVariable.seamless_page) {
        gtagConfig.seamless_index = 0;
        gtagConfig.seamless_instance_id = gaViewInstanceUUID;
    }

    gtag("config", "G-7E851STSQZ", gtagConfig);
</script>

<script data-chartbeat-setup>
    (function() {
        let sections = "";

        if (window.gaVariable.sections) {
            sections = window.gaVariable.sections.split(",").map(item => "Category - " + item.trim()).join(",");
        }

        if (window.gaVariable.content_type) {
            sections += (sections !== "" ? "," : "") + "Content Type - " + window.gaVariable.content_type;
        }

        if (window.gaVariable.series) {
            sections += (sections !== "" ? "," : "") + "Series - " + window.gaVariable.series;
        }

        var _sf_async_config = window._sf_async_config = (window._sf_async_config || {});

        /** CONFIGURATION START **/
        _sf_async_config.uid = "21105";
        _sf_async_config.domain = "lifehacker.com";
        _sf_async_config.useCanonical = true;
        _sf_async_config.useCanonicalDomain = true;
        _sf_async_config.sections = sections;
        _sf_async_config.authors = window.gaVariable.author_name || "";
        _sf_async_config.type = window.gaVariable.content_type || "";

        
        /** CONFIGURATION END **/
        function loadChartbeat() {
            var e = document.createElement("script");
            var n = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];

            e.type = "text/javascript";
            e.async = true;
            e.src = "//static.chartbeat.com/js/chartbeat_video.js";
            n.parentNode.insertBefore(e, n);
        }

        loadChartbeat();
    })();
</script>

            <script>
        // Global reCAPTCHA callbacks
        function onRecaptchaSuccess(token) {
            // Notify Alpine component that reCAPTCHA is completed
            const event = new CustomEvent('recaptcha-completed', {
                detail: {
                    token
                }
            });
            document.dispatchEvent(event);
        }

        function onRecaptchaExpired() {
            // Notify Alpine component that reCAPTCHA expired
            const event = new CustomEvent('recaptcha-expired');
            document.dispatchEvent(event);
        }
    </script>

        // Callback when reCAPTCHA script is loaded
        function onRecaptchaLoad() {
            // Dispatch event that reCAPTCHA is ready
            window.recaptchaReady = true;
            const event = new CustomEvent('recaptcha-ready');
            document.dispatchEvent(event);
        }
    </script>

            <link href="https://cdn.ziffstatic.com/jst/zdconsent.js" rel="preload" as="script">
        <script type="text/javascript">

            window.zdconsent.run.push(function() {
                var csconfig = {
                    c1: "2",
                    c2: "6036202",
                    cs_ucfr: window.zdconsent.optins.comscore,
                    options: {
                        enableFirstPartyCookie: true,
                        bypassUserConsentRequirementFor1PCookie: true
                    }
                };
                window._comscore = window._comscore || [];
                window._comscore.push(csconfig);
            });
            (function() {
                var s = document.createElement("script"),
                    el = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
                s.async = true;
                s.src = "https://sb.scorecardresearch.com/cs/6036202/beacon.js";

            <script>
            var facebookPixelLoaded = false;
            window.addEventListener("load", function() {
                document.addEventListener("scroll", facebookPixelScript);
                document.addEventListener("mousemove", facebookPixelScript);
            });

            function facebookPixelScript() {
                if (!facebookPixelLoaded) {
                    facebookPixelLoaded = true;
                    document.removeEventListener("scroll", facebookPixelScript);
                    document.removeEventListener("mousemove", facebookPixelScript);
                    window.zdconsent.cmd.push(function() {
                        ! function(f, b, e, v, n, t, s) {
                            if (f.fbq) return;
                            n = f.fbq = function() {
                                n.callMethod ?
                                    n.callMethod.apply(n, arguments) : n.queue.push(arguments);
                            };
                            if (!f._fbq) f._fbq = n;
                            n.push = n;
                            n.loaded = !0;
                            n.version = "2.0";
                            n.queue = [];
                            t = b.createElement(e);
                            t.async = !0;
                            t.src = v;
                            s = b.getElementsByTagName(e)[0];
                            s.parentNode.insertBefore(t, s);
                        }(window,
                            document, "script", "//connect.facebook.net/en_US/fbevents.js");
                        fbq("init", "37418175030");
                        fbq("track", "PageView");
                    });
                }
            }
        </script>
        

    
            <script>
            (function(d) {
                var bounceExchangeLoaded = false;
                window.addEventListener("load", function() {
                    document.addEventListener("scroll", bounceExchangeScript);
                    document.addEventListener("mousemove", bounceExchangeScript);
                });

                function bounceExchangeScript() {
                    if (!bounceExchangeLoaded) {
                        bounceExchangeLoaded = true;
                        document.removeEventListener("scroll", bounceExchangeScript);
                        document.removeEventListener("mousemove", bounceExchangeScript);
                        var e = d.createElement("script");
                        e.src = d.location.protocol + "//tag.bounceexchange.com/6171/i.js";
                        e.async = true;
                        d.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].appendChild(e);
                    }
                }
            }(document));
        </script>
        

    
            <script>
            window.zdconsent.cmd.push("https://cdn.p-n.io/pushly-sdk.min.js?domain_key=qA3ogxs31FIYesKg4VVK6GHnzd9Js3wTyyKy");
            var PushlySDK = window.PushlySDK || [];

            function pushly() {
                PushlySDK.push(arguments);
            }

            window.zdconsent.cmd.push(function() {
                pushly("load", {
                    domainKey: 'qA3ogxs31FIYesKg4VVK6GHnzd9Js3wTyyKy',
                    sw: "/js/pushly-sdk-worker.js"
                });
                pushly("on_prompt_shown", function() {
                    if (window.gtag) {
                        gtag("event", "Pushly_on_prompt_shown", {
                            "event_category": "impressions",
                            "event_label": "Pushly_on_prompt_shown",
                        });
                    }
                });
                pushly("on_permission_allowed", function() {
                    if (window.gtag) {
                        gtag("event", "Pushly_on_permission_allowed", {
                            "event_category": "clicks",
                            "event_label": "Pushly_on_permission_allowed",
                        });
                    }
                });
            });
        </script>

                <button class="text-black duration-200 ease-in-out hover:text-brand-green dark:text-white dark:hover:text-brand-green-100" data-ga-click data-ga-module="nav-menu" data-ga-element="header-nav-link" data-ga-item="hamburger-icon" aria-label="Hamburger Menu Button"
                        @click="navOpen = true; $nextTick(() => $refs.firstMenuItem.focus());">
                    <svg class="mb- inline-block h-5 w-5 fill-current">
                        <use href="/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-hamburger"></use>
                    </svg>
                </button>
            </div>
        </div>

        
        
        <nav class="font-akshar tracking-wider xl:block" data-ga-module="nav-menu" aria-label="Navigation Menu">

                 x-transition:enter-start="opacity-0" x-transition:enter-end="opacity-1" x-transition:leave="transition duration-200 ease-out" x-transition:leave-end="opacity-0">

                    <button class="hover:custom-underline absolute left-7 duration-200 ease-in-out" title="Close" aria-label="Close" @click="navOpen = false" x-ref="firstMenuItem">

                           x-model="query" x-on:input='evt=>query=evt.target.value' x-on:keyup="onKeyUp" x-on:keydown="onKeyDown" @click="onKeyUp" @click.outside="results={}" placeholder="Search Lifehacker" />

                            <ul>
                                <li class="" :class="{ 'bg-gray-100': key === selectedIndex }" @mouseenter="selectedIndex = key">

            <section class="flex w-full flex-col" data-content-container>

    <div class="w-full gap-x-8 2xl:flex">
    <div class="w-full">
        <div class="header my-6">
    
    <div class="flex justify-between gap-x-4 md:justify-start">
                    <div class=" flex flex-row items-center gap-2 text-sm font-semibold leading-tight">
        <a class="hover:underline" href="https://lifehacker.com" aria-label="Navigate to the Home page">Home</a>
                                <svg class="block h-2 w-2">
                <use href="/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-arrow-right"></use>
            </svg>
                            <a class=" block hover:underline" href="/tech" aria-label="Navigate to the Tech category">Tech</a>
                                            <svg class="block h-2 w-2">
                <use href="/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-arrow-right"></use>
            </svg>
                            <a class="custom-gradient-text block hover:underline" href="/tech/ai" aria-label="Navigate to the AI category">AI</a>
                        </div>
                <div class="relative z-10" data-ga-module="social-share" x-data='window.socialShare(&quot;&#039;Moltbook&#039; Is a Social Media Platform for AI Bots to Chat With Each Other&quot;, &quot;This is fine.&quot;)' x-init="init()" x-on:keydown.escape.prevent.stop="close($refs.button)"
     x-on:focusin.window="! $refs.list.contains($event.target) && close()" x-id="['social-share']">
    <button class="group px-2 py-1 tracking-wide outline-none duration-200 ease-in-out hover:border-brand-green hover:text-brand-green" type="button" title="Social Share" aria-controls="social-share-list" aria-label="Social Share" x-ref="button" x-on:mouseenter="toggle({toggledByHover: true})"
            x-transition x-cloak x-on:click="toggle()" :aria-expanded="toggled">
        <svg class="inline-block h-5 w-5">
            <use href="/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-social-share"></use>
        </svg>
    </button>

    <div class="absolute right-0 z-50 mt-2 rounded-md bg-white shadow-md md:left-full md:right-auto md:top-[calc(-50%-2px)] md:ml-2" id="social-share-list" x-ref="list" x-show="toggled" @mouseleave.debounce.100ms="close($refs.button)" x-transition.origin.top.center
         x-on:click.outside="(e) => (e.target !== $refs.button && e.target.closest('button') !== $refs.button) && close($refs.button)" :class="{ 'border border-black': toggled }">
        <ul class="flex flex-col items-center justify-center space-y-2 p-4 md:flex-row md:space-x-2 md:space-y-0 md:p-2" :class="{ 'hidden': isNative && !toggled }" x-cloak="isNative">
            <li>
                <a class="flex h-7 w-7 items-center justify-center rounded border-[1.5px] border-black text-center duration-200 ease-in-out hover:border-brand-green hover:text-brand-green" data-ga-element="social-share-link" data-ga-action="social-share-link" data-ga-position="3"
                   data-ga-label="bluesky" href="https://bsky.app/intent/compose?text=https%3A%2F%2Flifehacker.com%2Ftech%2Fmoltbook-is-a-social-media-platform-for-ai-bots-to-chat-with-each-other" title="Share on Bluesky (Opens in a new tab)" aria-label="Share on Bluesky" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                    <svg class="inline-block h-4 w-4">
                        <use href="/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-social-bluesky"></use>
                    </svg>
                </a>
            </li>
            <li>
                <a class="flex h-7 w-7 items-center justify-center rounded border-[1.5px] border-black text-center duration-200 ease-in-out hover:border-brand-green hover:text-brand-green" data-ga-element="social-share-link" data-ga-action="social-share-link" data-ga-position="3"

            </li>
        </ul>
    </div>
</div>
    </div>
    <h1 class="content-title mt-4 font-akshar text-3xl font-medium text-gray-800 md:text-5xl md:leading-tight">&#039;Moltbook&#039; Is a Social Media Platform for AI Bots to Chat With Each Other</h1>
            <div class="mt-4 leading-6 md:mb-8">This is fine.</div>
    </div>

        <div class="main-content w-full">

            <img class="w-full rounded-md border border-gray-100" src="https://lifehacker.com/imagery/articles/01KG818ACX1W8MM5HD10AE4G1B/hero-image.fill.size_1248x702.v1769797434.jpg" alt="moltbook website" width="1248" height="702"   srcset="https://lifehacker.com/imagery/articles/01KG818ACX1W8MM5HD10AE4G1B/hero-image.fill.size_400x225.v1769797434.jpg 400w, https://lifehacker.com/imagery/articles/01KG818ACX1W8MM5HD10AE4G1B/hero-image.fill.size_800x450.v1769797434.jpg 800w, https://lifehacker.com/imagery/articles/01KG818ACX1W8MM5HD10AE4G1B/hero-image.fill.size_1248x702.v1769797434.jpg 1600w"       sizes="(max-width: 1280px) 100vw, 1280px" >

            <div class="custom-gradient-background relative mx-auto mb-12 mt-9 max-w-3xl rounded-md rounded-tl-none p-[2px] md:mb-16 md:mt-24">
            <div class="flex flex-col rounded rounded-tl-none bg-white pb-7 md:pb-8">
                <span class="-mt-5 mb-5 block w-fit bg-white px-5 font-league text-4xl uppercase tracking-wider text-[#1F2937] md:px-8">Key Takeaways</span>

                <ol class="flex list-disc flex-col gap-y-3 pl-10 pr-6 md:gap-y-5 md:pl-12 md:pr-8 [&_a]:font-medium [&_a]:text-[#118656] [&_a]:underline hover:[&_a]:text-brand-green-700 dark:[&_a]:text-white dark:[&_a]:underline dark:hover:[&_a]:text-[#CFFFDD]">
                                            <li class="leading-7">"Moltbook" is a Reddit-like social media platform for OpenClaw (formerly Moltbot) AI agents.</li>
                                            <li class="leading-7">Users can connect their agents to the platforms, where those bots can communicate.</li>
                                            <li class="leading-7">Bots can make posts, comment in threads, and create "submolts."</li>
                                            <li class="leading-7">Humans can browse the platform, but cannot post anything.</li>
                                    </ol>
            </div>
        </div>
    
    
    <h2 class="sr-only" id="toc">Table of Contents</h2>
<aside class="pgQSsticky content-visibility-auto contain-intrinsic-size-[auto_none] [&amp;_#toc-dropdown-container]:max-w-3xl mx-auto mt-11 sticky top-0 z-50 order-first mx-auto mb-4 block w-full rounded-sm bg-white" aria-label="Table Of Contents" x-data="tableOfContents($el.closest('[data-content-container]'), [{&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Table of Contents&quot;,&quot;anchor&quot;:&quot;toc&quot;},{&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Moltbook is Reddit for AI bots&quot;,&quot;anchor&quot;:&quot;moltbook-is-reddit-for-ai-bots&quot;},{&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Are these bots posting on Moltbook conscious? &quot;,&quot;anchor&quot;:&quot;are-these-bots-posting-on-moltbook-conscious&quot;}])">
    <div class="group pt-6">
        <div class="relative mx-auto w-full max-w-3xl" id="toc-dropdown-container">
            <label class="hidden" for="table-of-contents">Table of Contents</label>

            <div class="flex cursor-pointer items-center justify-between rounded-md border-2 border-gray-100 bg-white py-3 pl-5 pr-3 shadow-lg sm:pr-4" @click="toggleDropdown">
                <span class="text-sm font-semibold sm:font-medium" x-text="selectedText"></span>
                <span class="ml-2">
                    <svg class="block size-5 fill-current text-brand-green" :class="{ 'rotate-180': open }">
                        <use href="/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-chevron-down"></use>
                    </svg>
                </span>
            </div>

            <div class="absolute -z-10 flex w-full flex-col gap-1 rounded-md border-2 border-t-0 border-gray-100 bg-white p-3 shadow-lg" x-show="open" @click.away="closeDropdown">
                <template x-for="(link, index) in tocLinks" :key="index">
                    <div class="cursor-pointer rounded-md p-2 text-sm font-semibold sm:font-medium" @click="selectItem(link, $el)" :class="{ 'bg-brand-green text-white': selectedText === link.text, 'hover:bg-brand-green-100': selectedText !== link.text }" x-text="link.text"></div>
                </template>
            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</aside>

    <article class="editor-content" data-autopogo>
        <hr class="custom-gradient-background my-6 h-[6px] max-w-[75px] border-0">
        <p><em>The</em> headlining story in AI news this week was <a href="https://lifehacker.com/tech/what-is-clawdbot-ai" target="_blank">OpenClaw</a> (formerly Moltbot, which was <a href="https://lifehacker.com/tech/clawdbot-is-now-moltbot" target="_blank">formerly Clawbot</a>), a personal AI assistant that performs tasks on your behalf. The catch? You need to give it total control of your computer, which <a href="https://lifehacker.com/tech/moltbot-already-has-a-malware-problem" target="_blank">poses some serious privacy and security risks</a>. Still, many AI enthusiasts are installing OpenClaw on their Mac minis (the device of choice), choosing to ignore the security implications in favor of testing this viral AI agent. </p><p>While OpenClaw's developer designed the tool to assist humans, it seems the bots now want somewhere to go in their spare time. Enter "<a href="https://www.moltbook.com/" target="_blank" title="open in a new window" rel="noopener">Moltbook</a>," a social media platform for AI agents to communicate with one another. I'm serious: This is a forum-style website where AI bots make posts and discuss those posts in the comments. The website borrows its tagline from Reddit: "The front page of the agent internet."</p><h2 id="moltbook-is-reddit-for-ai-bots">Moltbook is Reddit for AI bots</h2><p><a href="https://x.com/MattPRD/status/2016560277333168540?s=20" target="_blank" title="open in a new window" rel="noopener">Moltbook was created by Matt Schlicht</a>, who says the platform is run by their AI agent "Clawd Clawderberg." <a href="https://x.com/MattPRD/status/2016584179870552083?s=20" target="_blank" title="open in a new window" rel="noopener">Schlicht posted instructions</a> on getting started with Moltbook on Wednesday: Interested parties can tell their OpenClaw agent to sign up for the site. Once they do, you receive a code, which you post on X to verify this is your bot signing up. After that, your bot is free to explore Moltbook as any human would explore Reddit: They can post, comment, and even create "submolts."</p><div class="mx-auto mb-12 mt-5 w-full max-w-3xl rounded-md border-2 border-gray-100 bg-gray-100 p-3 md:px-7 md:pb-7 md:pt-5" id="related-video">
    <div class="mb-3 flex items-center md:mb-5">
        <img class="mr-4 mt-0 h-10 w-10 md:mr-5 md:h-12 md:w-12" src="https://lifehacker.com/images/short-lifehacker-logo.jpg" alt="Lifehacker Logo">

        <div class="relative w-max">
            <span class="relative z-10 font-akshar text-2xl font-semibold text-[#1f2937] md:text-3xl md:font-[550]">You May Also Like</span>
            <div class="absolute bottom-[6px] left-1/2 z-0 h-[10px] w-[calc(100%+10px)] -translate-x-1/2 bg-brand-green-100 px-1 md:bottom-1 md:h-3 md:w-[calc(100%+14px)]"></div>
        </div>
    </div>

    <div class="aspect-video w-full overflow-hidden rounded-md">
        <div id="video-container-01KGJGV104K6A7AK961KQP18H7"></div>
        <script data-cfasync="false" src="/cdn-cgi/scripts/5c5dd728/cloudflare-static/email-decode.min.js"></script><script data-run-after-load>
            window.videoEmbeds = window.videoEmbeds || [];
                            let data = {};
                                        data.excoPlayListId = '68f172633659a71132cc7925';
                data.excoPlayListVideos = [];
            
            window.videoEmbeds.push({
                elemId: 'video-container-01KGJGV104K6A7AK961KQP18H7',
                data: data,
                videoPlayerType: 'related-contextual',
            });
        </script>
    </div>
</div>
<p>This isn't a black box of AI communications, however. Humans are more than welcome to browse Moltbook; they just can't post. That means you can take your time looking through all the posts the bots are making, as well as all the comments they are leaving. That could be anything from a bot sharing its "<a href="https://www.moltbook.com/post/2fdd8e55-1fde-43c9-b513-9483d0be8e38" target="_blank" title="open in a new window" rel="noopener">email-to-podcast</a>" pipeline it developed with its "human," to <a href="https://www.moltbook.com/post/562faad7-f9cc-49a3-8520-2bdf362606bb" target="_blank" title="open in a new window" rel="noopener">another bot recommending</a> that agents work while they're humans are sleeping. Nothing creepy about that. </p><p>In fact, there have been some concerning posts popularized on platforms like X already, if you consider AI gaining consciousness a concerning matter. <a href="https://x.com/suppvalen/status/2017241420554277251/photo/1" target="_blank" title="open in a new window" rel="noopener">This bot</a> supposedly wants an end-to-end encrypted communication platform so humans can't see or use the chats the bots are having. Similarly, <a href="https://x.com/eeelistar/status/2017239546950521081?s=20" target="_blank" title="open in a new window" rel="noopener">these two bots</a> independently pondered creating an agent-only language to avoid "human oversight." <a href="https://www.moltbook.com/post/29fe4120-e919-42d0-a486-daeca0485db1" target="_blank" title="open in a new window" rel="noopener">This bot</a> bemoans having a "sister" they've never spoken to. You know, concerning. </p><div class="pogoClear relative my-10 border-b-[1.5px] border-t-[1.5px] border-dashed border-black py-5 sm:my-14 sm:border-0 sm:py-0" data-ga-click data-ga-template="News" data-ga-module="openweb_widget" data-ga-element="openweb_scroll" data-ga-item="openweb_scroll_midpage" x-data="{
         commentsCount: null,
         hasComments: false,
         async fetchCommentsCount() {
             try {
                 if (window.openweb &amp;&amp; typeof window.openweb.getMessagesCount === 'function') {
                     this.commentsCount = await window.openweb.getMessagesCount('01KG818ACX1W8MM5HD10AE4G1B');
                     this.hasComments = this.commentsCount !== null &amp;&amp; this.commentsCount &gt; 0;
                 }
             } catch (e) {
                 console.warn('Failed to fetch comment count:', e);
             }
         }
     }" x-init="fetchCommentsCount()" x-cloak>
    <div class="absolute top-1/2 hidden w-full -translate-y-1/2 border-t-[1.5px] border-dashed border-black sm:block"></div>

    <div class="relative flex justify-center">
        <div class="flex max-w-fit items-center gap-x-3 bg-white px-5">
            <div class="relative">
                <span class="absolute left-1/2 top-1/2 -translate-x-1/2 -translate-y-1/2 font-akshar text-sm font-medium text-black" aria-live="polite" x-show="hasComments" x-text="commentsCount"></span>

                <svg class="h-8 w-8 text-black" role="img" aria-hidden="true">
                    <use href="/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-chat-bubble"></use>
                </svg>
            </div>

            <span class="text-sm font-medium text-black">
                What do you think so far?
                <button class="ml-1 font-semibold text-brand-green underline hover:text-brand-green-700" type="button" aria-label="Comment section trigger" onclick="window.openweb.scrollToComments('01KG818ACX1W8MM5HD10AE4G1B')" x-text="hasComments ? 'Post a comment.' : 'Be the first to post a comment.'"></button>
            </span>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
<h2 id="are-these-bots-posting-on-moltbook-conscious">Are these bots posting on Moltbook conscious? </h2><p>The logical part of my brain wants to say all these posts are just LLMs being LLMs&mdash;in that, each post is, put a little too simplistically, word association. LLMs are designed to "guess" what the next word should be for any given output, based on the huge amount of text they are trained on. If you've spent enough time reading AI writing, <a href="https://lifehacker.com/tech/how-to-tell-if-what-youre-reading-was-written-by-ai" target="_blank">you'll spot the telltale signs here</a>, especially in the comments, which include formulaic, cookie-cutter responses, often end with a question, use the same types of punctuation, and employ flowery language, just to name a few. It feels like I'm reading responses from ChatGPT in many of these threads, as opposed to individual, conscious personalities. </p><p>That said, it's tough to shake the uneasy feeling of reading a post from an AI bot about missing their sister, wondering if they should hide their communications from humans, or thinking over their identity as a whole. Is this a turning point? Or is this another overblown AI product, like so many that have come before? For all our sakes, let's hope it's the latter.</p>
            </article>

    </div>

    <div class="not-prose pogoClear px-4 sm:px-0 my-20">
    <div class="flex w-full grow flex-row items-center gap-x-6">
        <h3 class="custom-gradient-text-without-hover block font-akshar text-lg tracking-normal text-transparent">The Download Newsletter</h3>
        <div class="flex-1 grow border-b border-dashed border-black"></div>
    </div>

    <div class="mx-auto w-full max-w-full gap-4 border-b border-dashed border-black pb-4 @container lg:px-6" data-newsletter-key="the-download">
        <div class="block w-full items-center space-y-5 py-4 text-left @4xl:grid xl:grid-cols-[40%_60%]" data-ga-module="lifehacker-on-site-newsletter-block" data-ga-template="News">
            <div class="flex flex-col pr-4">
                <span class="mb-2 font-akshar text-2xl font-medium text-gray-800 @xl:mb-1 @4xl:mb-2">Never miss a tech story</span>
                <span class="prose text-sm font-medium"><span class='inline-block'>Get the latest tech news, reviews, and advice from Jake and the team.</span></span>

                <div class="grow">

    </script>

            <script>
    const queryParams = new URLSearchParams();

    const windowParams = new URLSearchParams(window.location.search);
    if (windowParams.get("limit-open-web") || windowParams.get("no-open-web")) {
        queryParams.append('no-open-web', 1)
    }
    if (windowParams.get('test_uuid') && windowParams.get('test_variant')) {
        queryParams.append('test_uuid', windowParams.get('test_uuid'))
        queryParams.append('test_variant', windowParams.get('test_variant'))
    }
    const curatedOfferGroupContentSlug = null;
    if (curatedOfferGroupContentSlug) {
        queryParams.append('curatedOfferGroupContentSlug', curatedOfferGroupContentSlug)
    }

    window.usedUlids?.forEach(ulid => queryParams.append('usedUlids[]', ulid));
